title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.11.21-22 | 12-07-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: He satisfies everyone in terms of one's development of spiritual consciousness.
segments.summary: The lecture begins by explaining how Lord Krishna reciprocates with different types of devotees and admirers, contrasting this with the impersonalists' view of the Absolute Truth.

segments.key_quote: So when he is the absolute controller, how can that energy which he absolutely controls put him in illusion? That's never possible.
segments.summary: This segment discusses the nature of the Absolute Truth as the Supreme Person with transcendental qualities, contrasting this with the impersonalists' misunderstanding of Krishna's incarnations and emphasizing that the Lord is always liberated.

segments.key_quote: Nobody was ignored, nobody was considered too insignificant for the Lord to give his attention.
segments.summary: The lecture moves to the 22nd verse, explaining how Krishna greeted everyone present, regardless of their social standing, highlighting his unlimited power and personal reciprocation with each devotee.

segments.key_quote: So that is not the position of Krishna, the Supreme Personality of Godhead. He has unlimited power, he is an unlimited personality.
segments.summary: This segment contrasts Krishna's unlimited capacity to reciprocate with everyone to the limited capacity of worldly people, emphasizing that all living entities are eternally related to Krishna as His parts and parcels.

segments.key_quote: But the Lord is equally affectionate to all his parts and parcels despite material gradation.
segments.summary: The lecture explains why there are gradations among living entities despite being part and parcel of Krishna, attributing it to different levels of material contamination, and emphasizes Krishna's equal affection for all, highlighting His descent to recall them back to His kingdom.

segments.key_quote: Living being has free will and the Lord never forces himself upon anyone that you must come now.
segments.summary: The lecture concludes by emphasizing the free will of the living being to accept or reject Krishna's invitation to return to Krishnaloka, reminding the audience of the miseries of material existence and encouraging them to prepare themselves to return to the spiritual kingdom.
